Rob Reiner's son charged with two counts of first-degree murder, could face death penalty if convicted
subhed: Nick Reiner was taken into police custody on Monday, the day after the bodies of his parents were discovered in their Los Angeles home. He is being held without bail. 'These charges carry a maximum sentence of life in prison without the possibility of parole or the death penalty,' LA District Attorney Nathan Hochman said on Tuesday.

title: Inside one of New York's 'community kitchens', at the forefront of the cost-of-living crisis in the United States
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Morocco: Images of the flooding in Safi that has left 37 dead on the Atlantic coast
subhed: Flash flooding in Safi, on Morocco's Atlantic coast, killed 37 people on Sunday. This is the highest death toll from such weather events in the country over the past decade.

title: 'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhed: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.
